name: Calcarea silicata
Relationship: Compare: Arsenic; Tubercul.; Baryt. carb.; Iod.

Head: Corneal exudation
Vertigo, head cold, especially at vertex; catarrh of nose and posterior nares, discharge thick, yellow, hard crusts
Respiratory: Coughs with coldness, weakness, emaciation, sensitiveness and peevishness, worse from cold air
Stomach: Sensation of coldness, especially when empty
Skin: Itching, burning, cold and blue, very sensitive

details: A deep, long acting medicine for complaints which come on slowly and reach their final development after long periods. Hydrogenoid constitution (Nat-sulph.). Very sensitive to COLD. PATIENT IS WEAK, EMACIATED, COLD AND CHILLY, BUT WORSE FROM BEING OVERHEATED; sensitive generally. Atrophy of children.
dosage: All potencies from lowest to high.
